snippet: The British band Spiritualized performed at Terminal 5, led by Jason Pierce, who delights in a brazen guitar line.
abstract: Jon Pareles reviews performance by British space rock band Spiritualized at Terminal 5. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: Simplicity marries excess in Spiritualized, the long-running British band that performed at Terminal 5 on Monday night. Three or four chords, a handful of verses and a brazen guitar line are all Jason Pierce, a k a J. Spaceman, needs for songs that can heave along for a good 10 minutes without wearing out their welcome. Mr. Pierce, who was born in 1965, is dedicated to full-fledged, old-fashioned psychedelic rock that doesn't jam so much as it stews, rolling through its chords as the songs heat up, thicken and sometimes boil over.

headline.main: The Road to Rapture, Paved With Rock
